definition: to rotate
wheel/disk/ring/steamship/to take turns/to rotate/by turn/classifier for big round objects: disk, or recurring events: round, turn
see 轉文|转文[zhuai3 wen2]
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)
merry-go-round

sentences.english: Imprecise computation model was introduced to rotational scheduling algorithm.
sentences.chinese: 方法将非精确计算模型引入到轮转式调度算法中。

sentences.english: This new rotary press prints very rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 这种新型轮转印刷机印刷得很快。

sentences.english: Spinlocks are used frequently in the Linux kernel itself.
sentences.chinese: Linux内核中大量用到了轮转锁。

sentences.english: The Company is now added a new six-color rotary press and screen printing machine.
sentences.chinese: 本公司现又增加了全新六色轮转印刷机及丝网印刷机。

sentences.english: Start with a soft, slow roll, gradually picking up the pace and pressure.
sentences.chinese: 开始要轻柔，慢慢轮转，逐步提高步调和压力。

sentences.english: Spinlocks are less commonly used at the user-level.
sentences.chinese: 轮转锁在用户级中很少用到。

sentences.english: It is common to mix gravure and web offset forms in the same issue.
sentences.chinese: 这是常见的组合凹版印刷和轮转的形式相同的问题。

sentences.english: Spinlocks should never be used on uniprocessor machines. Why is this?
sentences.chinese: 轮转锁在单处理器机器上不能使用。这是为什么呢？

sentences.english: Screen business card printing and membership card to make a platform and Rotary.
sentences.chinese: 网版制卡和会员卡制作有平台式和轮转式之分。

definition: to rotate/to take turns/to switch
to reincarnate/reincarnation (Buddhism)/(of the seasons etc) to follow each other cyclically/cycle/CL:個|个[ge4]
variant of 輪迴|轮回[lun2 hui2]
to take turns/to work by roster
troop arrangement/battle formation/lineup (of a sports team etc)
to take over (from one another)/to alternate/to replace/to relay
lit. the Big Dipper 北斗星[Bei3 dou3 xing1] has turned and the stars have moved/time flies/also written 星移斗轉|星移斗转[xing1 yi2 Dou3 zhuan3]
life and death
Paul
to work/to operate/to revolve/to turn around
to defend/to protect (against)
attack and defense/the midfield (in soccer)
formation (of a sports team, troops etc)
to attack/to assault/to go on the offensive/attack/assault/offense (sports)
to transform/to convert/to vary/to alternate/a transformation
to grow and multiply without end
the sun and moon/day and month/every day and every month/season/life and livelihood
